page.title: 15EDUCATION AND EMPLOYMENT
page.content: {(Coppice primary school) } The school was built in January 1953 as an infants school, in 1962 it became a Primary school. The school has had six headteachers. In the opinion of our infant teachers who have been here since the school has been built the area is a lot better. The children come from smaller families and can behave better. Pupils at the school have worked on this project. {(Employment in Marlpool)} We asked 55 junior aged children about their parents' jobs. There are 46 fathers who work and 34 mothers. 14 mothers and 33 fathers work outside Heanor and the rest in Heanor. 22 men work at a factory,2 drive a taxi,8 are miners, 2 are firemen and 4 work in an office.13 women are cleaners, 9 work in a factory,3 in shops, 3 are dinner ladies,2 cooks and 2 are at college.
